newsitem.title: JAPAN: Dog bites 19 children in rampage at Japan school.
newsitem.headline: Dog bites 19 children in rampage at Japan school.

text.p: A homeless dog bit 19 students on Friday in a frightening rampage through classrooms of a primary school on Japan's northernmost island of Hokkaido, a police spokesman said.
The spokesman said hospital authorities were checking to ensure the animal, a long-haired Shetland Collie, was not a rabies carrier.
He said the dog's attack was triggered when children surrounded the animal to pet it after it strayed onto the school's playground in the village of Asahikawa.
Confused and angered by the attention, the animal snapped at the children and chased them when they fled from the playground into the school's classrooms.
The dog continued to chase the children as they ran from room to room until it was subdued by the school's headmaster.
Hospital authorities treated 19 children, mainly nine-year-olds, for minor scratches and bites.
The animal had no collar and its shaggy hair and half-starved condition indicated it had lived in the wild for some time, the police spokesman said.
Police have caged the animal until a decision is made on its fate.
